awd_titl_txt: Seismic Investigation of the Kaokiki Fault Zone: the Origin of Large Earthquakes in Hawaii
awd_abstract_narration: This research investigates the cause of major earthquakes on                  the volcanic island of Hawaii, a timely and controversial                       question.  The seismic method is to record on both permanent and                temporary seismometers the waves from local and distant                         earthquakes to outline the extent of the buried sediment layer at               the volcanic pile-ocean crust interface.  If this layer coincides               in depth with the low-angle-faulting earthquakes observed in the                Kaoiki Fault Zone, the results will support the hypothesis that                 major earthquakes are slips along this zone.  Because this                      research deals directly with earthquake hazard, it is a                         contribution to the National Earthquake Hazard Reduction                        Program.
